title: Steroid-Free Disease Categories Deep Dive
key_findings: Cardiovascular: 100% precision for beta blockers, calcium blockers, diuretics, vasodilators
Psychiatric: 90% precision for atypical antipsychotics, 80% for typical
~70% of cardiovascular novel predictions are clinically plausible
~40% of psychiatric novel predictions are plausible (SSRIs/stimulants for bipolar are CONTROVERSIAL)
Model captures drug mechanisms but misses psychiatric contraindication rules
Canagliflozin for HF is a CORRECT novel prediction (PROVEN in trials post-GT curation)
recommendations: Cardiovascular predictions are high-quality - prioritize for external validation
Psychiatric: Add SSRI/stimulant contraindication rules for bipolar disorder
Consider Sotatercept → PAH as emerging novel prediction (STELLAR trial 2023)
